name: Observation Awakening
description:
Upon Awakening Observation Haki.
  • Your starting Range is 5ft.
  • Your starting Focus modifier is +2.
  • Your observation vision appears like a black and white scribble drawing

name: Vision I
description:
You can make out colors as well as details (not intricate ones though) You can now feel slight emotions with your Observation Haki. When you use Observation Haki you gain
  • +3 to Perception and investigation checks
  • +3 to Insight

name: Range I
description: Your Observation Range increases by 10ft.

name: Range II
description: Your Observation Range increases by 15ft.

name: Focus I
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +2

name: Focus II
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +3

name: Killer Instinct I
description: As a bonus action you read your opponent’s intentions and gain advantage on your attacks against them for this round

name: Killer Instinct II
description: While using Killer Instinct, your crit range increases by 1

name: Short Sight I
description: As a reaction you can add 1d4 to one attack roll that you missed

name: Short Sight II
description: As a free action you can add 1d4 to 2 attack rolls per round that you missed

name: Keen Focus I
description: You can add your focus modifier to one attack roll once per combat

name: Keen Focus II
description: You can add your focus modifier to (prof bonus) attack rolls per combat.

name: Foresight I
description: As a bonus action you give yourself +1 ac and +1 for all saving throws until your next round or twice the amount by using an action

name: Foresight II
description: As a bonus action you give yourself +2 ac and +2 for all saving throws until your next round or twice the amount by using an action

name: Quick Escape I
description: As a reaction when you would get hit or fail an area-of-effect saving throw, you can decrease an incoming attack roll by 1d4 to try to make it miss or increase your saving throw by the same amount. (Doesn't work on Nat 20’s)

name: Quick Escape II
description: When you use your reaction to use Quick Escape, if the attack missed or you succeeded the saving throw; you can move 10 ft without provoking opportunity attacks. If this movement takes you out of an aoe effect’s range, you avoid all the dmg. (Doesn't work on Nat 20’s)

name: Lucky Dodge I
description: As a Reaction, you can force an attack that hit you to be rerolled once per combat. (Doesn't work on Nat 20’s)

name: Lucky Dodge II
description: As a Reaction, you can force an attack that hit you to be rerolled (prof bonus) times per combat. (Doesn't work on Nat 20’s)

name: Vision II
description:
You can now see small details and hear clear sounds. You can maintain a lazy form of observation haki passively at all times (as if drawn by a child) During combat, you can make a perception check at the start of your turn for free to detect hidden creatures. You can hear surface level thoughts (1st part of detect thoughts). When you use Observation Haki you gain
  • +6 to Perception and investigation checks
  • +6 to Insight

name: Foresight III
description: As a bonus action you give yourself +3 ac and +3 to saving throws for 1 min (Even if used with action, only the 1st round gains 2x benefit from this)

name: Foresight IV
description: As a bonus action you give yourself +5 ac and +5 to saving throws for 10 minutes (Even if used with action, only the 1st round gains 2x benefit from this)

name: Foresight V
description:
As a bonus action you give yourself +6 ac and +6 to saving throws for 10 minutes (Even if used with action, only the 1st round gains 2x benefit from this)
You can see a faint glimpse into the near future.

name: Quick Escape III
description: As a reaction when you would get hit or fail an area-of-effect saving throw, you can decrease an incoming attack roll by 1d4 to try to make it miss or increase your saving throw by the same amount. (Doesn't work on Nat 20’s)

name: Quick Escape IV
description: As a free action, when you would get hit or fail an area-of-effect saving throw, you can decrease an incoming attack roll by 1d6 to try to make it miss or increase your saving throw by the same amount. However if you use your reaction, you can roll 2d6 and you can move 20 ft without provoking opportunity attacks.

name: Quick Escape V
description: As a free action, when you would get hit or fail an area-of-effect saving throw, you can decrease an incoming attack roll by 1d8 to try to make it miss or increase your saving throw by the same amount. However if you use your reaction, you can roll 3d6 and you can move 30 ft without provoking opportunity attacks.

name: Lucky Dodge III
description: As a free action, you can force an attack that hit you to be rerolled (prof bonus) times per combat. (Now works on Nat 20’s)

name: Lucky Dodge IV
description:
When you use Lucky Dodge, you can force the attack that hit you to be rerolled twice. 
You can now use Lucky Dodge (prof bonus) x 2 times per combat.

name: Lucky Dodge V
description: When you roll a Nat 20 on attack rolls or saving throws, regain one use of Lucky Dodge.

name: Killer Instinct III
description: If you already had advantage from a different source, you now gain triple advantage.

name: Short Sight III
description:
As a free action you can now add 1d6 to all attack rolls that you miss. 
As a reaction you can add 2 of the dice (instead of the 1 that is a free action)

name: Keen Focus III
description: When you hit an attack while using Keen Focus, you can add your Focus Modifier to the damage.

name: Break Defense I
description: You can use your bonus action to try to break through your opponent's defensive observation haki. To do this you must win a contested focus check against the enemy. If you win, the opponent’s focus is considered broken for your next attack. (If used on someone with Break Offense, they can add the extra modifiers to the contested check)

name: Break Defense II
description: You can use your bonus action to try to break through your opponent's defensive observation haki. To do this you must win a contested focus check against the enemy. If you win, the opponent’s focus is considered broken for your next attack. (If used on someone with Break Offense, they can add the extra modifiers to the contested check)

name: Break Offense I
description: You try to negate any benefits your opponent’s offensive observation haki would grant against you. This can be done as a reaction to an attack made with the aid of observation haki and for it to work you must win a contested focus check against the enemy. If you win, the enemy’s focus is considered broken against you for that attack. (If used on someone with Break Defense, they can add the extra modifiers to the contested check)

name: Break Offense II
description: You can add your prof bonus to these kinds of focus checks and the focus is considered broken against you for the whole turn

name: Break Offense III
description: The focus is considered broken for the whole round, but can be regained at the start of the enemy’s next round without an additional focus check)

name: Break Offense IV
description: Does not cost a reaction and can be used freely

name: Range III
description: Your Observation Range increases by 30ft.

name: Range IV
description: Your Observation Range increases by 60ft.

name: Focus III
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +4

name: Focus IV
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +5

name: Vision III
description:
You can now read text with observation haki and make out even the smallest of details and hear the faintest of whispers. You can see every hidden/invisible creature within your range You can now probe deeper into a target’s mind (the target can try to resist) to read their thoughts. You can use “detect thoughts” spell at will When you use Observation Haki you gain
  • +9 to Perception and investigation checks
  • +9 to Insight

name: Killer Instinct IV
description: While using Killer Instinct, your crit range increases by 2

name: Short Sight IV
description:
As a free action you can now add 1d8 to all attack rolls that you miss.  
As a reaction you can add 2 of the dice (instead of the 1 that is a free action).

name: Keen Focus IV
description: You can now use Keen Focus (prof bonus)x2 times per combat.

name: Killer Instinct V
description:
You always gain triple advantage when using this and your crits deal 3 extra weapon/spell dice worth of dmg.
You can see a faint glimpse into the near future.

name: Short Sight V
description:
As a free action you can now add 1d8 to all attack rolls that you miss. 
As a reaction you can add 3 of the dice (instead of the 1 that is a free action). 
While using short sight the damage is treated as if it were elemental for armament haki purposes.

name: Keen Focus V
description: When you roll a Nat 20 on attack rolls or saving throws, regain one use of Keen Focus.

name: Break Defense III
description: The opponent's focus is considered broken for the whole round. (They can still make a normal Observation check at the start of their turn.)

name: Break Defense IV
description: The opponent’s focus is completely broken and their dc to regain it is at least 30

name: Range V
description: Your Observation Range increases by 380ft.

name: Range VI
description: Your Observation Range increases by 500ft.

name: Focus V
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +6

name: Focus VI
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +7

name: Vision IV
description:
Voice Of All Things When you use Observation Haki you gain
  • +15 to Perception and investigation checks
  • +15 to Insight

name: Range VII
description: Your Observation Range increases to 1 mile.

name: Focus VII
description: Your Observation Focus modifier increases by +8
